page.title: 11Dairy Farm 2:The Deverills
page.content: A typical day at{Mill Farm}begins with milking at 7.OOam, then the calves are fed. In the summer-time, the cows are put out to grass on strips controlled by an electric fence. In winter time, the cows are fed silage or hay indoors and manure is hauled out,then the farmer works his fields. Lunch is always at one o' clock. At 4.00 pm it is milking time again and the calves are fed. Tea is at 5.45pm, then when silage-making or hay-making work continues as long as there is light. The farm is worked by the farmer and his wife and son. Work on the farm has changed, it is far more mechanised. The first tractor was introduced onto the farm in 194O. Now the farmer has 2 tractors,a dung spreader, 2 ploughs, a silage trailer, a mower and hay maker. He has a herring-bone milking parlour and a bulk milk tank instead of churns
